CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many labels are in this radar chart?
How many dimensions are in this radar chart?

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Price-to-Income Ratio?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Price-to-Income Ratio is Capital Appreciation Rate

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Price-to-Income Ratio?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Price-to-Income Ratio is Yearly Price Growth Rate.

SRP.Q: On the Capital Appreciation Rate, is the point for port inside or outside the point for side?
SRP.A: On the Capital Appreciation Rate, the point for port is inside the point for side.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Price Volatility Index} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of side?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Price Volatility Index}, while the weakest aspect is{ Yearly Price Growth Rate}.

VPR.Q: On dimension Capital Appreciation Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Capital Appreciation Rate, label {port} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Capital Appreciation Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Capital Appreciation Rate, label {port} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of side on the Capital Appreciation Rate in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of side on the Safety dimension is {68}.

VE.Q: What is the value of side on the Transaction Volume Growth in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of side on the Safety dimension is {54}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label side across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of side across all dimensions is {50}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label side across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of side across all dimensions is {77}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Price-to-Income Ratio
SC.A: The average value of Price-to-Income Ratio is {67.0}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of port
SC.A: The average value of port is {50.8}.

NF.Q: Which labels have scores below 30 for the Capital Appreciation Rate dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.
Which labels have scores above 46 for the Yearly Price Growth Rate dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.
For side in the radar chart, which dimensions have scores above 72? Please list the dimensions and corresponding scores.

NC.Q: For port, which dimension has a higher score: Price-to-Income Ratio or Yearly Price Growth Rate?
NC.A: {Price-to-Income Ratio} has a higher score than Yearly Price Growth Rate for port.

NC.Q: On Price-to-Income Ratio, which label has a higher score: port or the side?
NC.A: {port} has a higher score on Price-to-Income Ratio compared to side.

NC.Q: For side, which dimension has a higher score: Transaction Volume Growth or Price-to-Income Ratio or Yearly Price Growth Rate?
NC.A: {Price-to-Income Ratio} has a higher score for side.

NC.Q: For side, which dimension has a higher score: Capital Appreciation Rate or Yearly Price Growth Rate or Price Volatility Index?
NC.A: {Price Volatility Index} has a higher score for side.

MSR.Q: For side, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: side most needs to improve its {Yearly Price Growth Rate}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {side}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {port}.
